{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3439894,"name":null,"username":"amgniv","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/e68b1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-10-26T08:04:19.770Z","cooked":"

Hi, My team recently bought a limelight 3a. We were massing around with the pipelines color detection, AI and python snapscript.After about 2-3 weeks of us working with the limelight and everything was OK. Suddenly both of the status lights turned off and we couldn’t connect to the web UI (at the same time i was using the python snapscript), At the limelight hardware manager after we connect the limelight only the IP address was visible and we can see a message pop out: Connection closed unexpectedly to ...* on ‏‏Ethernet 2.
When I thought about flashing the limelight after all the necessary preparations i opened belenaEtcher but it couldn’t find the limelight despite it being connected to the computer directly via cable.
After that i tried downloading the bonjour app after I show someone suggesting it but I didn’t show any improvement.
I tried finding the limelight in the camera section of the PC hardware manger but I didn’t find it, The only place a could find it is in the cmd when I typed ipconfig /all i show a device with the same IP as the IP in the limelight hardware manger.

I will say that i tried to connect the limelight with a different cable but it didn’t work.

Thanks to everyone who comment in advance.

Contact Limelight Support Contact us – Limelight Vision I find they are very responsive. It could be a hardware issue

It sounds like you’ve been thorough enough with your troubleshooting. When both status lights are off and you can’t connect, it’s sometimes a power or connection issue, but since you’ve already checked different cables and adapters, it’s probably something else.

First, try a hard power cycle—unplug everything, wait for a minute or two, then reconnect and see if that helps. Directly entering the Limelight’s IP address in the browser can sometimes bypass connection issues if the web UI isn’t loading normally.

Since you were using the Python SnapScript when it disconnected, there’s a slight chance that the script caused a temporary crash or disconnection, especially if it was accessing hardware intensively. Sometimes, forcing the Limelight into safe mode (holding down the button while powering it on) can help it recover and be detected as a new device for re-flashing.

If BalenaEtcher isn’t finding the Limelight, you could try Win32 Disk Imager as an alternative—it’s sometimes better at detecting stubborn devices. And if it’s still not coming up, you might be dealing with a firmware or hardware issue that Limelight support could help with like the other person said. They might have specific steps for a reset or recovery process.
